item.title: Thousands died needlessly after mistakes says Cummings
item.description: Boris Johnson's former aide says the PM is "unfit for the job" over his handling of the pandemic.

item.title: Covid: Biden orders intelligence report on virus origin
item.description: The US president gives intelligence agencies 90 days to report amid controversy over its origin.

item.title: Hillsborough trial: Men acquitted as judge rules no case to answer
item.description: Two ex-police officers and a force solicitor are acquitted of perverting the course of justice.

item.title: Covid: France imposes quarantine on UK travellers
item.description: France joins Austria and Germany in introducing restrictions due to the spread of the Indian variant.

item.title: Eurovision 2021: James Newman on coming last for the UK
item.description: The singer didn't get a single point in Rotterdam, leaving the United Kingdom bottom of the pile.

item.title: San Jose shooting: Eight killed in California rail yard shooting
item.description: The shooting took place at a regional rail yard in San Jose, California early on Wednesday.

item.title: Holiday islands considered for green list
item.description: Islands such as the Canary Islands and Majorca may be put on the UK's green list of holiday destinations.

item.title: Cummings: Care home protective shield was 'nonsense'
item.description: Former Downing Street adviser Dominic Cummings says care homes lacked tests and protection.

item.title: Batley school protests: Teacher allowed back in Prophet Muhammad image row
item.description: The teacher can return to the school after showing pupils a caricature of the Prophet Muhammad.

item.title: Mayhill riot: 'I have two children inside, please come'
item.description: Adam Romain pleads with police as a mob in Swansea targets his house with his young family inside.

item.title: Covid: Russia starts vaccinating animals
item.description: Russia has started vaccinating animals with what it says is the world's first animal-specific jab.

item.title: Friends reunion: 10 of the best moments
item.description: The six stars have reunited for a new televised special, 17 years after Friends drew to a close.

item.title: Dominic Cummings: The seven most explosive claims
item.description: The PM's former chief aide makes a series of allegations about the government's Covid response.

item.title: Dominic Cummings: What was on his whiteboard?
item.description: The notes reveal a scramble to decide the country's pandemic response ahead of the first lockdown.

item.title: Five things Cummings told MPs about Covid response
item.description: The prime minister's former aide has been speaking to MPs about the government's handling of Covid-19.

item.title: Driving lessons and Covid: 'I've been turned away by 50 instructors'
item.description: Learners are on waiting lists for lessons as instructors struggle to meet the post-lockdown demand.

item.title: GalÃ¡pagos tortoise found alive is from species thought extinct
item.description: Tests carried out on a giant tortoise found in 2019 confirm it belongs to a species believed extinct.

item.title: Nick Knowles to return to DIY SOS role despite Shreddies advert
item.description: But the host will miss a Children in Need special because the Shreddies advert will still be on TV.

item.title: Leicester City's FA Cup win ends woman's 73-year wait for ring
item.description: Margaret Angell was told by her skint fiance she could have a ring when Leicester lifted the FA Cup.

item.title: From protests to 'patriots': Why China is crushing Hong Kong dissent
item.description: After clamping down on protests it has reformed elections - what does this mean for Hong Kong's future?

item.title: Cummings' claims fact-checked
item.description: Boris Johnson's former chief adviser made a series of claims and allegations about the government's response to the pandemic.

item.title: 'I've been ghosted by my insurer'
item.description: Thousands of small businesses are still waiting for Covid-related insurance payouts.

item.title: Amateur choirs 'devastated' at Covid rule change in England
item.description: Hundreds of choirs have had to cancel rehearsals after the government said singing poses a health risk.

item.title: Mothers demand apology over forced adoptions
item.description: Some of the 250,000 unmarried women forced to give up babies say it led to a lifetime of grief.

item.title: Jerusalem's Sheikh Jarrah: The land dispute in the eye of a storm
item.description: Moves to evict Palestinians in a Jerusalem district helped ignite the recent Israel-Gaza conflict.

item.title: Letter from Africa: Why Queen of England has a throne in Nigeria
item.description: A myth among the Efik people is that one of their 19th Century kings married Queen Victoria.

item.title: Covid: 'The horror of laying everyone off made me sick'
item.description: Company bosses and managers talk about the impact of the pandemic on their mental health.

item.title: Conte leaves Inter Milan - three weeks after leading club to first title in 11 years
item.description: Antonio Conte leaves his role as Inter Milan manager - three weeks after leading club to Serie A title.

item.title: Martin wins first Giro stage as Yates gains time after leader Bernal cracks
item.description: Ireland's Dan Martin wins his first ever stage at the Giro d'Italia as Britain's Simon Yates reduces the gap to overall leader Egan Bernal.

item.title: Injured Foakes out of England Test squad as Hameed and Billings brought in
item.description: England wicketkeeper Ben Foakes will miss the two Tests against New Zealand in June with a hamstring injury, while opener Haseeb Hameed and keeper Sam Billings are added to the squad.

item.title: Chelsea return unsold Champions League final tickets amid criticism over charter packages
item.description: Chelsea return more than 800 unsold tickets for the Champions League final with Manchester City in Porto.

item.title: Bronze? Weir? Furness? Ingle? Pick your Team GB Olympics starting XI
item.description: Hege Riise is set to name her 18-player Team GB squad for the rearranged Tokyo Olympics on Thursday, but who makes your starting XI?

item.title: Dortmund chase Chelsea duo, Liverpool agree Konate deal - Thursday's gossip
item.description: Boubakary Soumare close to Leicester move, Ibrahima Konate set for Liverpool, Borussia Dortmund want Tammy Abraham, plus more.

item.title: UK holidays: When and where can I go.... and who with?
item.description: The rules on having a holiday in the UK have been relaxed - but restrictions remain.

item.title: Covid: What's the roadmap for lifting lockdown?
item.description: People are now being told to minimise travel to eight areas of England where Covid is spreading fast.

item.title: Covid Indian variant: Where is it, how does it spread and is it more infectious?
item.description: The Indian variant is spreading in some parts of the country - how serious is it?

item.title: Covid: When will I get the vaccine?
item.description: People in their 20s and 30s are now being offered a Covid vaccine as the UK rollout continues.

item.title: What are the rules for travelling to green, amber and red list countries?
item.description: Foreign holidays are now possible, but travellers must follow strict rules on their return.

item.title: What are the rules for weddings and can I hold a reception?
item.description: Restrictions on weddings have been eased across the UK - so how can you now celebrate?

item.title: Lockdown rules: What are the restrictions in your area?
item.description: Use our search tool to find out about coronavirus rules and restrictions where you live.

item.title: Children tell of neglect, filth and fear in US asylum camps
item.description: The BBC has uncovered allegations of cold temperatures, sickness, lice and abuse, through a series of interviews with children and staff at US detention camps for children.

item.title: Martin Bashir inquiry: Diana, the reporter and the BBC
item.description: The full story of how the BBC's Martin Bashir got his 1995 interview with Princess Diana - and what happened next.

item.title: The black children wrongly sent to 'special' schools in the 1970s
item.description: In the '60s and '70s, black children were wrongly sent to schools for the "educationally subnormal".

item.title: Uyghur imams targeted in China's Xinjiang crackdown
item.description: China has targeted Muslim religious leaders, according to a new report, charging many with extremism.
